page.title: 09Kington St Michael School
page.content: The school is attended by 52 children (as at 12/7/85), who are divided into three classes. Up until 1978 the school was next to the Village Hall, and opposite the Church and Post Office. This{old school}was built in 1866, and{Herbert Prodgers,}who was then the owner of the Manor, put up most of the money, at a cost of Â£650. In 1903 the Headmistress,{Miss {White,}was receiving Â£76 a year, with an attendance of about 99 children. {The present school,}which is at the end of The Ridings, was moved into on Wednesday 11th.October 1978. It has three classrooms, although one of these is also the Hall. Most of the children who attend walk from within the village. Only two or three are brought in from Chippenham or Hullavington.
